# 1. Introduction

```{r}
library(vroom)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
```
```{r}
courses <- vroom::vroom(
  "courses.csv",
  delim = ",",
  col_types = list(
    course = col_character(),
    course_id = col_integer(),
    trimester = col_integer(),
    nb_grades = col_integer()
  )

```

# 2)

```{r}
courses <- courses %>%
  rename(
    
    course_name = course,
    identifier = course_id,
    number_of_exams = nb_grades
  ) %>%

knitr::kable(courses)
```

```{r}
# Calculer âge en années entières (arrondi à l'entier le plus proche si besoin)
library(lubridate)

students <- students |>
mutate(age = floor(time_length(today() - birth_date, unit = "year")))

students |>
ggplot(aes(x = age)) +
geom_histogram(binwidth = 1, boundary = 0, closed = "left") +
```

#  3. Simple grade analysis

# 10)

```{r}
n_grades <- grades |>
  filter(!is.na(grade)) |>
  nrow()

cat("The data set contains", n_grades, "grades.\n")
```
# 11)


```{r}
target_course <- courses %>%
  filter(course_name == "Moral Philosophy and Ethical Decision-Making")

print(target_course)  # Vérifier

course_id_target <- target_course$course_id[1]

avg_grades <- grades %>%
  filter(course_id == course_id_target, !is.na(grade)) %>%
  left_join(students %>% select(id, group), by = "id") %>%
  group_by(group) %>%
  summarise(avg_grade = mean(grade, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%
  arrange(group)

print(avg_grades)  
print(paste("Nombre de groupes:", nrow(avg_grades)))

# Graphique
avg_grades %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = factor(group), y = avg_grade)) +
  geom_col(fill = "steelblue", color = "black", width = 0.7) +
  labs(
    x = "Group", 
    y = "Average Grade", 
    title = "Average Grades in Moral Philosophy and Ethical Decision-Making by Group"
  ) +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 12) +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(face = "bold"),
    axis.text.x = element_text(size = 10)
  )
```

```{r}
comm_course <- courses |>
```

#  5. Grade analysis

# 19)

```{r}
avg_by_student_course <- grades |>
  filter(!is.na(grade)) |>
  group_by(id, course_id) |>
  summarise(avg_grade = mean(grade, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")

avg_by_student_course <- avg_by_student_course |>
  left_join(courses |> select(course_id, course_name), by = "course_id")

student_course_wide <- avg_by_student_course |>
  select(id, course_name, avg_grade) |>
  pivot_wider(names_from = course_name, values_from = avg_grade)

student_course_wide <- students |>
  select(id, group) |>
  left_join(student_course_wide, by = "id")

student_course_wide |>
  select(id, group, everything()) |>
  slice_head(n = 6) |>
  kable()
```

# 20)

```{r}
rad_course <- courses %>% 
  filter(str_detect(tolower(course_name), "radiation ecology"))
rad_id <- rad_course$course_id[1]

comm_course <- courses %>% 
  filter(str_detect(tolower(course_name), "community building"))
comm_id <- comm_course$course_id[1]

rad_comm_avgs <- avg_by_student_course %>%
  filter(course_id %in% c(rad_id, comm_id)) %>%
  select(id, course_id, avg_grade) %>%
  pivot_wider(names_from = course_id, values_from = avg_grade)

colnames(rad_comm_avgs)[colnames(rad_comm_avgs) == as.character(rad_id)] <- "rad_avg"
colnames(rad_comm_avgs)[colnames(rad_comm_avgs) == as.character(comm_id)] <- "comm_avg"

rad_comm_avgs <- rad_comm_avgs %>%
  filter(!is.na(rad_avg) & !is.na(comm_avg))

print(head(rad_comm_avgs))
print(paste("Nombre d'étudiants:", nrow(rad_comm_avgs)))

ggplot(rad_comm_avgs, aes(x = comm_avg, y = rad_avg)) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.6, size = 3, color = "steelblue") +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = TRUE, color = "darkred") +
  labs(
    x = "Average Grade: Community Building and Social Organization",
    y = "Average Grade: Radiation Ecology and Environmental Science",
    title = "Relationship Between Course Grades"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()
```

# 22)

```{r}
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)

# Vérifier quels étudiants ont pris les deux cours
students_with_both <- avg_by_student_course %>%
  filter(course_id %in% c(1, 9)) %>%
  group_by(id) %>%
  summarize(n_courses = n_distinct(course_id)) %>%
  filter(n_courses == 2)

print(students_with_both)

# Si des étudiants ont les deux cours, calculer les corrélations
if(nrow(students_with_both) > 0) {
  data_wide <- avg_by_student_course %>%
    filter(course_id %in% c(1, 9), id %in% students_with_both$id) %>%
    select(id, course_id, avg_grade) %>%
    pivot_wider(names_from = course_id, values_from = avg_grade)
  
  print(data_wide)
  
  # Corrélation globale
  cor_result <- cor(data_wide$`1`, data_wide$`9`, use = "complete.obs")
  print(paste("Corrélation:", cor_result))
} else {
  print("Aucun étudiant n'a pris les deux cours")
}

```

# 26)

```{r}

student_course_avg <- avg_by_student_course %>%
select(id, course_id, avg_grade) %>%
left_join(courses %>% select(course_id, trimester), by = "course_id")

cond1 <- student_course_avg %>%
group_by(id) %>%
summarise(any_below_5 = any(avg_grade < 5, na.rm = TRUE))

trimester_avg <- student_course_avg %>%
group_by(id, trimester) %>%
summarise(trim_avg = mean(avg_grade, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")

cond2 <- trimester_avg %>%
group_by(id) %>%
summarise(all_trim_ge_10 = all(trim_avg >= 10, na.rm = TRUE))

pass_df <- final_grade_df %>%
left_join(cond1, by = "id") %>%
left_join(cond2, by = "id") %>%
mutate(
any_below_5 = replace_na(any_below_5, FALSE),
all_trim_ge_10 = replace_na(all_trim_ge_10, FALSE),
pass = (!any_below_5) & (all_trim_ge_10)
) %>%
select(id, group, final_grade, pass)

pass_df %>% slice_head(n = 10) %>% kable()

```

```{r}
n_fail_but_high <- nrow(fail_but_high)
cat("Number of students who do not pass but have final_grade >= 10:", n_fail_but_high, "\n")
```
